## Problem

Assume that  the Armington aggregator $A(x,y)$  is increasing in both arguments, homogeneous of degree one, and concave. Show that $A_2(x,y)/A_1(x,y)$ can be written as $P(x/y)$, with $P'(\cdot)>0$.
